full_summary:
### Janitorial Services – Canso Canal, Port Hastings, N.S.

#### Tender Notice
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is inviting bids for a contract to provide janitorial services at the Canso Canal facility in Port Hastings, Nova Scotia.

#### Solicitation Details
- **Solicitation Number: 30005250A**
- **Contracting Authority: Fisheries and Oceans Canada**
- **Address: 200, Kent Street, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada**
- **Phone: (343) 550-1758**
- **Email: tammy.otoole@dfo-mpo.gc.ca**
- **Notice URL:** [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/)
- **Attachements:**
\[Addendum 01_2.pdf\]\[RFP.EN.pdf\]

#### Background
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada's (DFO) Real Property, Safety & Security division is looking for a contractor to provide daily cleaning services for the Canso Canal facility in Port Hastings, Nova Scotia.

#### Description of Work
The winning bidder shall provide all labor, materials, tools, supervision, and equipment necessary to maintain the facility's cleanliness, with a focus on the two buildings requiring cleaning, occupying an area of 776 m². The successful vendor will also adhere to two mandatory cleaning seasons and perform obligatory cleanings on statutory holidays.

#### Site Visit
An optional site visit has been scheduled for the.vendor interested in participating should communicate their interest with the Contracting Authority by **May 13, 2024**. The site visit will be conducted at the DFO Canso Canal facility on **May 23, 2024**, at 11:15 AST. Bidders are welcome to attend to confirm details and gather site information. The contract will be awarded to the lowest bidder meeting the contract requirements.

#### Contract Details
- **Contract Start Date:** July 2, 2024
- **Contract End Date:** March 31, 2029
- **Contract Value:** To be determined by the Contracting Authority based on the awarded bid

This tender notice serves as a formal invitation for vendors interested in partnering with the Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada for this project. Please familiarize yourself with the scope of work and related documents.
